Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:Ubuntumobile.jpg|right|thumb|Hildon in [[Ubuntu Mobile and Embedded Edition]]]]
+
[[Image:Ubuntumobile.jpg|right|thumb|300px|Hildon in [[Ubuntu Mobile and Embedded Edition]]]]
'''Hildon''' is an [[application framework]] for [[Linux]] [[operating system]] mobile devices ([[PDA]]s, [[mobile phone]]s, etc), developed by [[Nokia]] for [[Maemo]] and now a part of [[GNOME]], that focuses on providing a finger friendly interface.<ref>[http://arstechnica.com/journals/linux.ars/2007/06/14/nokia-pushes-hildon-upstream Nokia Pushes Hildon Upstream]</ref> It is primarily a set of [[GTK]] extensions that provide mobile-deviceâoriented functionality, but also provides a [[desktop environment]] that includes a task navigator for opening and switching between programs, a control panel for user settings, and status bar, task bar and home applets.<ref>[http://maemo.org/maemo_release_documentation/maemo4.1.x/node6.html#SECTION00624000000000000000 Maemo Diablo 4.1 release documentation] - 5.2.4 Hildon Framework</ref> It is standard on the [[Maemo]] platform used by the [[Nokia]] [[Internet Tablet]]s.<ref>[http://maemo.org/development/documentation/tutorials/Maemo_tutorial_bora.html maemo Tutorial Bora]</ref>
'''Hildon''' is an [[application framework]] for [[Linux]] [[operating system]] mobile devices ([[PDA]]s, [[mobile phone]]s, etc), developed by [[Nokia]] for [[Maemo]] and now a part of [[GNOME]], that focuses on providing a finger friendly interface.<ref>[http://arstechnica.com/journals/linux.ars/2007/06/14/nokia-pushes-hildon-upstream Nokia Pushes Hildon Upstream]</ref> It is primarily a set of [[GTK]] extensions that provide mobile-deviceâoriented functionality, but also provides a [[desktop environment]] that includes a task navigator for opening and switching between programs, a control panel for user settings, and status bar, task bar and home applets.<ref>[http://maemo.org/maemo_release_documentation/maemo4.1.x/node6.html#SECTION00624000000000000000 Maemo Diablo 4.1 release documentation] - 5.2.4 Hildon Framework</ref> It is standard on the [[Maemo]] platform used by the [[Nokia]] [[Internet Tablet]]s.<ref>[http://maemo.org/development/documentation/tutorials/Maemo_tutorial_bora.html maemo Tutorial Bora]</ref>
